dialogue.raw_text: Okay, they're Go for the burn and MOI. Should be initiating the burn just about... now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Takes a step forward, staring helplessly at the screen. His face goes pale, stricken. His worst nightmare is taking place, right before his eyes -- and for the second mission in a row...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MARS ORBIT. NIGHT The REMO is now on the night side of Mars. Cargo boxes, packing cases and assorted equipment containers float outside. The hatch is sealed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MARS ORBIT. NIGHT McConnell hovers by a bulkhead. He's anguished, haunted by the image of Woody's death. We see him struggling to overcome his grief and shock, trying to force himself to concentrate on the critical tasks at hand. In front of him, a panel has been opened; he's facing
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Already glowing, surrounded by coded switches, indicator lights, com ports.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stares at these, thinking hard, remembering. He's holding a palm-sized computer, already wired into this panel. He begins tapping the keys, but then stops himself. Reconsiders. He turns, looking back at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hunched on what would be the floor if the REMO were on land. They grip stowage straps to keep from drifting. Clearly this tiny, rude cargo craft was never designed for manned operation. It's claustrophobic, bitterly cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is a map of torment. He is shivering, both from cold and fear, barely holding himself together. He hugs his computer supply case like a scared child would hug a teddy bear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is worse. A thousand-yard stare. She's in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Knows he has to occupy them. Speaks softly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phil looks up at him dully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After a moment Phil releases his strap, pushes towards McConnell. He stares numbly at the monitor for a few beats, then takes the little computer from McConnell. He begins to tap the keys, slowly at first, but then with more confidence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terri hesitates a moment, then looks at the strap in her hand, as if she's never seen it before. Dully she reaches for another one, begins looping them together.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Phil? (no response) Hey, Phil...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're going in blind. We'll deploy the chutes by laptop. I need to get on the data bus, put in a software patch, and try to soften this tin can's landing. I could use your help with the patch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's great. Good job. (turning to Terri) Hey, Terri, I was wondering. Think maybe we could rig some kind of seatbelts out of those cargo straps?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Studies both of their faces intently. Knows that he can't push them too hard, too fast. They're moving like robots, but at least they're moving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MARS ORBIT. NIGHT. (MINUTES LATER) Small thrusters are firing, getting the REMO into position for entry into the atmosphere. Then all the jets fire in unison, braking the REMO, as it falls away from us, towards Mars at night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HIGH ATMOSPHERE. NIGHT The astronauts, restrained on the floor by Terri's jury-rigged strap system, hold on for dear life. The buffeting through the atmosphere is shaking them violently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see the effect of the incredible g-forces: faces distorted, unable to focus their eyes. Each of them thinking, once again: Now I'm going to die...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The Mars One Base Camp looms in the foreground, like some desolate, otherwordly ghost town. And then, in the night sky beyond it, we see an eerie and beautiful sight: a bright streak of red as the REMO slashes down into the Martian atmosphere, like a shooting star, finally disappearing behind distant mountains. Then all is stillness again, deathly stillness and silence...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VIEWPORT. DAY Beck stands by a viewport, staring out into space. He's just lost four good friends, and also knows he is seeing, in this disaster, the probable end of the Mars Program, and the certain end of his own career. He doesn't, at first, even hear the nearby VOICE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beck looks up, his eyes red-rimmed. The CapCom shifts uneasily. He's holding a computer printout.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beck snatches the paper, staring at it. For the first time we see some life coming back into him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beck suddenly understands. And it's a joy to see his face, the tears of happiness that spring into his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The CapCom stares back at him, feeling the same surge of hope.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ray...? We've got some new data, just coming in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We just -- it doesn't make any sense. We're not sure how to read this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Data?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes sir. Telemetry reports the REMO has left its orbit and reached the Martian surface.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pause) Crashed?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No sir. Under power.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sixty-three minutes after Mars Recovery went off-line. Sir, the graph reads like a controlled descent. But that doesn't make any --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They used the REMO as a lander.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's McConnell, it's got to be! Nobody else could have pulled this off. Son of a bitch! They're alive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MARS ONE BASE CAMP. DAY POV ANGLE - WIDE As we see the Mars One Base Camp: silent, very still. In the distance, the massive ERV still looms, perched for takeoff, the bottom rungs of its ladder buried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NING We see that sand has drifted high against the Hab, as well as the sides of the partially-deflated tunnel and greenhouse, and the four-man rover. The oxygen still and propellant plant are almost buried. Solar panels, some of them punctured by micrometeors, FLAP and CREAK eerily in the slight breeze. And finally,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R TO CAMERA We see the camp's American flag, still on its toppled pole, but nearly obliterated by sand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are spooked by this desolation. They've paused at the edge of the camp. They have dragged along with them from their landing site a crude sledge, improvised from the REMO's hatch cover and some cargo straps. On this, their meager supplies. McConnell, glancing at the others, knows he's got to keep their spirits up. He kneels, digs out the flag pole. Brushing off the sand, he rights this and re-plants it firmly in the ground, packing the sand down with his boot. He stands for a moment looking at the flag, his eyes moist. Despite the cost, they have made it to Mars. When he turns, Terri and Phil are looking at him, moved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He catches himself. Phil and Terri look at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Better?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pause) Damn right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Terri, let's see if that oxygen still is operational. Phil, you better check out the ERV. I'll take the Hab. If you find Luke's --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just keep in touch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DAY Phil steps from the umber sand onto the ERV's ladder, begins to climb. The four-man rover is nearby, sand drifted high against its tires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Terri kneels by the oxygen still, begins to scoop away sand with her gloved hands. She still looks numb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY MCCONNELL (on radio) I'm at the main airlock door. He unlatches a panel, grips the emergency lever inside, tugs it. After a seeming eternity, the door groans and creaks open. Little puffs of dust and sand swirl about, settle.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Entering Hab.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DAY Perched atop the ERV's ladder, Phil, using a battery-powered drill, is just removing the final screw from the hatch cover. He lifts off the heavy cover, lets it tumble to the sand.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I've got ERV access. I'm going in. Terri, you okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DAY Terri is still scooping sand. She's just cleared the first row of gauges.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. This is gonna take awhile to get back to 100% capacity.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DAY McConnell walks through the kitchen, which we recognize. He pauses to look at the table from which Luke and his crew taped their final, fateful message.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still sits there, eerily, with its stub of burned-out candle. Half-finished, frozen cups of coffee. Suddenly, out of the corner of his eye, he catches a flash of white. He spins, startled, and sees
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . In his white pressure suit, staring back at him from the screen of a video monitor. Above this is perched the camera the Mars One astronauts used for their comm packets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This place is filled with ghosts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Phil, in the pilot's seat of the ERV, pushes a computer's power button. The screen flickers weakly to life, startling him a bit, but all he sees on it are white streaks, crazy static.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: appears structurally intact. Computers are fried, just as we thought.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DAY Terri has cleared more gauges, valves. She sits back on her heels, studying the tangle of pipes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Copy that. I've got busted filters here, clogged intakes. Helluva cleanup job, but so far no major damage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: DAY AN INNER AIRLOCK DOOR WHOOSHES OPEN, AND MCCONNELL ENTERS

direction.raw_text: . DAY AN INNER AIRLOCK DOOR WHOOSHES OPEN, AND MCCONNELL ENTERS. THEN STOPS, ASTONISHED. HIS POV On a fantastic, almost jungle-like atmosphere. The plants have been allowed -- encouraged? -- to grow wildly. Some are even pushing against the inflated roof. Water condenses on the leaves and the roof, then is captured and routed through pipes of every shape and size, dripping into a clever assortment of collection jars. Liquid water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reaches into a bucket, touches the water. His glove comes up before his wondering eyes, dripping. Grasping the implication, he looks down at his forearm instrument pad. Blinking red letters read "25 deg. C." And something else -- the puffy white material of his suit is starting to slightly deflate, revealing his arm's shape. There's air pressure in here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Punches in more numbers, and gets the readout: "Nitr. 78%/ 02 20%/ C02 1%/ Trace gasses 1%."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slowly reaches up, unsealing the neck ring of his helmet. He hesitates, then lifts it off. Takes a deep, quenching lungful of pure air. Holds it in. Lets it slowly out. For a moment he doesn't trust his own voice. Then speaks softly towards his helmet.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm in the greenhouse. You better... you better come see this for yourselves.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DAY Phil, still sitting at the cockpit controls, turns. Through a side viewport he can just make out the greenhouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no answer. He rises.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DAY Terri rises, concerned, and turns. Through the distant, translucent wall of the greenhouse, McConnell's shadowy figure can be seen, moving slowly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jim...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DAY McConnell sets down his helmet, starts exploring, pushing through fronds as he makes his way down an aisle. The dripping foliage is so dense it almost chokes his path. Everywhere he looks, he has the sense of a scrounged-together, recycled, jury-rigged environment, where a great deal of ingenuity has come into play. He pauses, looking up... Overhead, a bellows, stitched together from pieces of plastic tarp, slowly inhales and exhales, pumping air into a vent in the upper deck of the Hab. Its power comes from a crude water wheel, a buckets-and-strut assemblage, tidily sutured with duct tape, like some giant Erector set. As McConnell turns away from this, still marvelling, a ragged figure leaps through the foliage! It smashes into him, with a HARSH SCREECH, knocking him to the ground. McConnell, on his back, straddled by his attacker, fights back as best he can. A blur of flailing arms and fists, as he tries to push the creature away. Staring up, he catches a glimpse of the almost unrecognizable
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whose frightened eyes glare back at him through a swaying curtain of dreadlocks. His skin is creased, weathered, above a scraggly beard. His clothes are tattered, patched together. In one fist he grips a rock hammer, which he swings high overhead, about to drive the claw through McConnell's skull. McConnell grabs his arm desperately, trying to fend him off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see a flash of uncertainty in Luke's eyes. Then he yanks his arm free, and his hammer arcs up even higher, trembles in the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he stares down at McConnell, Luke's eyes finally light up with recognition. but before he can move, he is seized from behind and flung backwards to the ground, the hammer ripped from his grasp, as Terri and Phil pinion his arms. McConnell scrambles to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McConnell kneels beside Luke, signalling to Terri and Phil that it's okay to let him go. They stand back, pulling off their helmets. Everyone is panting, out of breath. Luke sits up, slowly studying their features, one after another, as if still not quite certain whether they might vanish. His voice is hoarse, rusty from disuse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke looks with incomprehension at McConnell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke stares at McConnell, trying to absorb everything. He looks to Terri, who looks down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke shakes his head in dismay. He seems to shrink in on himself. It's all too much for him to take in. McConnell kneels and puts his arm around Luke, comforting him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Luke, it's me! Jim McConnell!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Luke, it's Jim!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no, you're not... you can't be here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your wife is Debra! Your son is Bobby! You were reading Treasure Island with him...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't hurt him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Phil... Terri...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jim... I don't understand. You're not supposed to be here... Why are you here? Where's Woody?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He didn't make it Luke.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh no.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY (MINUTES LATER) Luke sits on the side of his cot, in the little tented sleeping area he's created in one corner of the greenhouse. Nearby, his hotplate, pots, and some freshly harvested vegetables and greens. The others crouch around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A flash of fear in Luke's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His voice drops to a conspiratorial whisper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He taps his forehead, significantly, then nods once or twice. The others exchange an uneasy glance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He rises quickly and scuttles off, waving an impatient hand, without waiting to see if they'll follow. McConnell, Terri and Phil stare after him for a long moment. Phil breaks the silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McConnell and Terri follow in the direction Luke went. Phil, trailing, mutters to himself.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Luke, what happened here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (whispers) We fired the radar. It came. They all died.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What came?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They all died, but I was spared. Why? Had to be for a reason. Then, all of a sudden, I knew why I was spared.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So somebody would be left to figure out the secret.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Luke, we still don't understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come. Comecomecome.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is it just me? Or is he about two mealpacks short of a picnic?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Long term exposure to low gravity can have an adverse impact on the brain. He could be suffering from a form of asphyxia.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Or maybe his whole crew died and he's been marooned alone on Mars. Let's give him time to adjust.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Greatgreatgreat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DAY Luke, now in a patched-up pressure suit and grubby-looking helmet, stands peering down unhappily at the improvised sledge, with its meager supplies. McConnell, Terri, and Phil walk up behind him, wearing their helmets again. They hear Luke over his RADIO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McConnell and the others are silent, embarrassed. Then McConnell nods. Luke looks at him, a cracked grin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He points to the computer repair case, as Phil lifts it off a sledge. Luke turns, looks at the case, then Phil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In some mysterious way, this reminder of Woody's death seems to bring him fully back into himself. He takes Terri by the shoulders, deeply saddened. She meets his gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She nods, grateful. A beat. He looks at the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He starts off across the sand, and they follow.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So... let me be sure I understand this. Your ship blew up, with all its supplies. Then you emptied the cargo out of the REMO, and it was totalled on landing. You've got no food, no water, no spare oxygen, nothing but what I see here...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What kinda rescue mission is this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That kind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Check it out. New nav boards for the ERV. I got four round-trip tickets, baby, right in here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Four.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Terri... I'm so sorry. He was a good man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks, Luke.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When there's time, we'll talk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DAY They stand looking down at the three long mounds of dirt, as Luke completes his account of the disaster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has to pause, collect himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is an emotional silence. Luke turns, takes a few steps. He stares into the distance, observing the swirling dust around them. McConnell hesitates, notices Luke's gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke looks off into the distance, studies something only he seems to see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McConnell pulls his gaze away from the horizon, looks at Luke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McConnell isn't quite sure how to reply to this.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...When I came to and dug myself out of the sand, my faceplate was cracked. Leaking badly. I barely made it back to Base. It was weeks before I could work up the nerve to go back out there and look for their...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Renee was the only one I could find. But it didn't seem right, somehow, to dig just one grave.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Has it been blowing like this for a while? (Luke nods) We saw a big storm from space. But Micker said it was turning south.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If it holds course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This -- whatever it was -- this force. You say it came directly out of the top of the mountain?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't believe me. That's okay. But I'm not crazy, Jim.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did you mean by its "secret?" What secret?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pause) You better see for yourselves.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY McConnell, Terri, and Phil follow Luke into the Science Lab area of the Hab, then stop in their tracks. Their helmets are off. It's very cold in here; their breath is frosty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- The Lab is crammed with rock and sand samples from many locations, all tagged and labelled. There are drawings and diagrams covering the walls: Martian landscapes, annotated maps, and over and over, obsessively repeated, drawings of the vortex that destroyed the Mars One crew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The others turn, looking at him. Luke is aiming an electric space heater at his computer. As the coils glow red, he rubs his hands together, poised over the keyboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke reacts to their blank stares. He has a kind of jittery feverish intensity, a secret excitement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The others exchange worried glances. Is he totally nuts?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the computer screen they're looking at...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: See, where they made their mistake was, they must've planned for it to be visible from Earth...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who's "they"?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't you understand? Hundreds of millions of years have gone by. You've got erosion, sand storms, lava flows, meteor impacts -- hell, in that much time, the whole surface would've changed. So no wonder we never saw it before. Well, I mean, we saw it, but not like they meant us too. Too much dirt on it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Saw what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Pictures of the Face after the disaster, seen from ground- level, in telephoto views. Rising out of a ring of rock and dirt rubble is the shiny-white profile of a gigantic face. The white is smooth, impenetrable. It has the scale of a mountain, but the planes and angles are clearly unnatural.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (INT. MARS ONE HAB.) They are stunned. Can hardly believe their eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few moments of silence while they try to absorb this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A click of the mouse and they all HEAR, over speakers, the DEEP PULSING BASS TONE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke is trembling with excitement. His words tumble out very quickly. He's been waiting so long to share this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He types another command. They all look at the monitor, the glow reflecting on their faces. They are amazed again.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is that...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. But whatever it is, somebody built it. And not us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about the sound? That signal you heard before the explosion?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good, Jim, good. That's the key.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hear the pauses? That's what made me realize it's a pattern -- a repeating pattern.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mathematical?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what I thought. There are distinct blocks in the pattern, and within each block the tones come in groups of three. Threethreethree. For months I struggled to analyze it, trying different constructs... Then I thought about dimensions.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: coordinates...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right! Three groups equals three dimensions... So I tried assigning different graphic values to each block, group and tone. And finally I got... this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Where we see the beautiful interlocking chain, the universally familiar double helix, of a DNA molecule -- the elegant blueprint of life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (INT. MARS ONE HAB.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She glances at him, surprised that he overheard her earlier diagnosis. But he smiles, not offended.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look at him. Then all four turn, stare again at the slowly rotating DNA, pondering its awesome mystery.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My God... Is that what I think it is?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... that's a model of DNA!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You see it, too. Thank God. I was afraid I was just suffering from a form of asphyxia.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, okay, so -- somebody left this thing here, somebody -- other than human. But what the hell is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My guess is, it's a signature. A self-portrait of whatever species created the Face.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But that DNA looks human.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No way. It's missing the last pair of chromosomes. See?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, but it's close. Damn close.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The difference between a man and an ape is less than three percent of genetic material. But that three percent gives you Mozart. Einstein.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Or Jack the Ripper.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: When he finally speaks, never takes his eyes off the screen. We can read in them the almost overwhelming grip this mystery has on his imagination.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The others nod in weary agreement. As they start out, towards the relative warmth of the greenhouse, Terri looks at Luke, at his scraggly beard and his long, lank hair. She smiles, brushing some locks off his forehead.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's been a long day. Let's get a couple hours sleep, then tackle this thing when we're fresher. Phil, your first priority will be to get the motherboards over to the ERV. Concentrate on getting communications up first. (Phil nods) Soon as we've got the juice, we'll send a packet to Micker, tell them Luke's OK, and that... everything else that's happened. The rest of us will take an inventory of supplies, see where we stand. Okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: C'mon. There's a pair of scissors in my medkit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ANOTHER SECTION. NEXT MORNING As in the Science Area, this space has enough thin oxygen for the astronauts to remain unhelmeted. McConnell and Luke are still going through what few supplies were salvaged from the REMO. Luke pauses, rubbing the unfamiliar smoothness of his cheek. His beard is gone, his hair neatly trimmed. McConnell enjoys Luke's own wonder at his transformation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McConnell smiles. Terri enters through the hatch, removing her helmet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McConnell, rummaging through Phil's backpack, drops an already- opened bag of M&Ms. The CANDIES scatter and bounce all over the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke and Terri smile. McConnell scoops up the fallen M&Ms. He slows down as he does it, looking at the scatter of little round CANDIES. Something tugging at the back of his mind...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How do you feel?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like I just got back my other three percent.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The backup generator is salvageable, and two of the solar panels. I'm pretty sure I can get the oxygen still back into production, too. So we're not in such bad shape, considering.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good work, Terri.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look at that. Phil's idea of absolute essentials.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVA AIRLOCK. DAY Phil's intricately designed M&M model of his "ideal woman", floating weightlessly, as McConnell drifts past it, plucking away a couple pieces of the candy. Phil reacting, in good- natured annoyance. The gap in the design left by McConnell's theft...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ANOTHER SECTION. DAY CLOSE ON MCCONNELL As he trembles with excitement. With sudden comprehension.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke and Terri stare at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's not a signature.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (puzzled) What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That noise from the Face... It's not a signature. It's a test.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . MOMENTS LATER McConnell sits in front of the computer back in the science lab area, staring once again at the mysterious DNA model. Luke and Terri stand behind him. McConnell's energy, his new certainty, is almost electrifying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terri and Luke look at each other, starting to understand.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's asking us for the right answer. It wants us to put in the missing pair of chromosomes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To prove that we're human.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We fired radar into that thing. Concentrated sound waves...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Which it interpreted as a wrong answer... Yes! It's like a, a security alarm. When it gets an incorrect response, it defends itself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DAY Phil is listening in on radio. He's got panels open, wires dangling, as he works his ongoing repair. He keys his mike, uneasily.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So what happens when it gets the right answer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DAY As McConnell looks at Luke and Terri.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke stares at him, startled by what he's implying.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (hesitates) I don't know. But we've got to find out. (to Luke, pointing) Can you work this the other way? Figure out which tones would be equivalent to the missing chromosomes? Then dub them into your recording of the signal?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think so, yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about the radar gun? Will it accept that input? Can we transmit a completed signal back to the Face?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DAY Phil is also growing increasingly nervous.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Whoa, whoa, hold on, Jim. What if you're wrong? Whoever goes out there... I mean, what if you're wrong? Three people have already died over that thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DAY As Luke and Terri look tensely at McConnell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McConnell looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terri shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His passion startles them; they've never seen him so emotional. He points at the computer screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look at him, surprised.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Four.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Terri, if we leave here without getting some answers, they all died in vain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We just don't know enough about that -- that thing out there to take any more chances.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are we here for, if not to take chances...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This means we're not alone. It means we're on the brink of the greatest discovery in mankind's history. But we've still got to prove it. Who knows when someone else will get back here? Or if they ever will? You know what Congress is like. They'll say it's too dangerous, too much loss of life, let's go back to unmanned flights. We could be the last explorers to come here for decades. We're it, guys. (pause) We're it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) We don't have to go out there. There's a better way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE FACE. PLAINS OF CYDONIA. DAY The familiar, plucky little figure of ARES-8 wheels across ocher sand, with the radar gun jury-rigged onto its back. Ares' video snout WHIRRS out, extending. The familiar bass rumble of the Face is very loud from here.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Checking video feed...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . LATE DAY McConnell, Terri, and Phil have gathered around Luke as he pushes buttons, and a monitor CRACKLES to life. White streaks, then a blurry image, which he tries to enhance. Finally the image starts to sharpen.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They see the familiar stark white profile of the FACE, shot from ground level, in a SLOWLY APPROACHING ANGLE...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stare at the ominous sight. They're all more nervous than they want to show. Luke's fingers delicately work a joystick as he maneuvers the remote surveyor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How close do we need to get?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not sure. Maybe we better stop by that boulder.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . THE FACE. LATE DAY Ares-8 whines to a stop by a large boulder, which partially shields it from the Face, looming beyond. The radar gun swivels, locating its target. Then stops, ready to fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LATE DAY Luke looks at Terri, Phil, and McConnell. Phil shuts the lid of the box holding the new nav boards, snaps it protectively down. He nods. Terri takes a deep breath, then she nods. Luke's hand hovers over the red firing button; a moment of awesome uncertainty and danger. He looks at McConnell, who finally gives a nod of command. Then Luke hits the button.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE FACE. LATE DAY From the radar gun on Ares-8's back, a sharp, high-pitched electronic burst is emitted, pulsating like a tuning fork as it's fired towards the Face. After a few seconds it stops. For a moment nothing happens. Then the deep bass rumbling stops as well. The only remaining sound is of WIND, stirring up dust on the Martian plains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As suddenly a huge, curved segment of the white surface begins to rise from the earth, like a gigantic hangar door, sliding out of sight into an upper sheath of some kind. The movement is measured, stately, utterly silent. As the segment rises, it reveals a blinding white light: the interior of the Face. No inside details can be seen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY McConnell, Luke, Terri and Phil stare at this phenomenon, awed. They're barely breathing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke punches buttons, waits anxiously for a readout.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McConnell is staring at the mysterious opening. On his face, a growing look of determination.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The others look at him, their expressions changing as they realize what he's implying.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my God...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It worked... It worked!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Check for radiation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Normal. Seismic... normal. Anemometer steady. No sign of the vortex.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know what we did, but guys -- does that look to you like a hostile gesture?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. More like an invitation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Or another test...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Luke, the four-man rover. Does it still work?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LATE DAY McConnell, once again helmeted, emerges from the Hab airlock. Luke, Terri and Phil are coming out behind him. The wind has picked up, and fine dust is blowing. They stop, staring off in astonishment towards
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The entire sky has darkened from its customary salmon into purplish-black at the horizon, with bloody streaks above. The DUST STORM has turned their way; it's now sixty kilometers away and closing. The main body of it reaches two thousand meters above the surface and stretches out along a thousand- kilometer front.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stare at this unholy juggernaut, alarmed. McConnell turns to Luke, whose expression is grim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McConnell stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McConnell turns, staring off towards the killer storm. The others look at him with questioning gazes. He turns again. There's the four-man rover, ready to go. Waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks a question at Luke and Terri, one after the other. Their eyes, tense but excited, signal agreement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McConnell nods, satisfied. Looks at Terri and Luke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They start towards the four-man rover. Dust is swirling more thickly through the air, and the WIND IS LOUDER NOW. Phil stands watching them go, a lone, rather forlorn figure.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How long before it hits?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: An hour? Maybe less.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How bad?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A storm like that? It could go planetary. And last a year.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It'll sock us in, Jim. We won't be able to take off. If that happens, with what few supplies we've got left...? We'll starve to death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Phil, how much longer to prep the ERV?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe forty-five minutes. It'll be tight, but we can make it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then there's still time for us to get out there and back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stay here. Continue the repair. If something goes wrong, you get out of here before that storm hits.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go back... alone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If we're not back in forty-five minutes, I want you to prep and launch. (looks at his armpad display) That's 1950 hours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jim -- MCCONNELL It's not a suggestion, it's an order. You understand?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reluctantly) I understand. But -- MCCONNELL You understand what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you're not back by 1950, I prep and launch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DUSK In a WIDE SHOT, we see the rover approaching the Face, across the plains. The sky beyond the Face is almost black, as the storm approaches from that direction. It's marching relentlessly across the planet, with flashes of lightning now rippling up and down its face, and even small tornadoes spinning off near its purple-black base...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DUSK Phil has panels off. He's reaching into the guts of the main computer, working feverishly. His repair kit is beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE FACE. DUSK In a HIGH SHOT, we look down across the side of the Face and its vast, open doorway, out of which the bright white light is streaming. Into this corridor of light, we see the rover arrive, slewing to a stop, throwing sand from its wheels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looking at the cavernous vertical gap in the side of the Face. The opening towers to a dizzying height above us; the white light strains our eyes. The three astronauts ENTER FRAME as we see them, from behind, staring up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they are stunned by the immensity of the scene, the cosmic mystery before them. Luke and Terri look at McConnell. Another moment of critical decision. He keys his mike.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Phil, do you read me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DUSK Phil keys his own mike.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, Jim. Your signal's breaking up a little in the storm, but I read you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DUSK McConnell stares into the bright opening. Bathed in its light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terri and Luke exchange a tense glance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke smiles. The three of them stare into the portal. McConnell, between the others, reaches out and grips each of them by a gloved hand. They take a sort of collective breath. Then they walk forward together, into the light.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We're at the Face. We're gonna need a few minutes here. Same deadline, launch at 1950. With or without us. Do you copy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pause) Copy that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jim, are you sure you want to do this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not sure of anything anymore. But I didn't come a hundred million miles just to turn back in the last ten feet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DUSK The astronauts continue forward, each of them extending a free hand. The light is too dazzling for them to gauge distances, textures, colors -- anything at all. They can't see walls, ceiling, even a floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind them, there is an abrupt WHOOOSH, like a giant airlock sealing shut. They turn, startled and nervous. Letting go of each other's hands, Luke and Terri run back the way they came, but almost immediately are stopped by a wall of some sort. The vast hangar-type door has closed behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The three scared, helmeted faces seem to float in the brightness, some twenty feet apart.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Surface seems firm and level.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Roger that. Texture is smooth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've got good footing and no obstructions. Let's check our --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's solid again! We're trapped.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't move! Keep this orientation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (keys his mike) Phil? Phil, can you still hear me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DUSK Phil, saying a silent prayer, reaches over and turns on the main computer. It works! He's immensely relieved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He glances out the cockpit window at the blowing dust. Then realizes that he's hearing only silence over his radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No answer. Phil stares at his radio in dread.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Computers are online! Ready to load software. But guys -- we're losing visibility here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Guys...? Jim? Luke? Terri? Is anyone there...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't leave me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DUSK McConnell is staring at his spacesuit's sleeve. He can see that the suit material is starting to deflate, revealing the shape of his arm, just as it did in Luke's greenhouse. He hesitates, then begins to unscrew the sealing ring on his right glove. Terri and Luke see this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McConnell makes the final twist on his glove and there's the hiss of rushing air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke looks at his sleeve. McConnell's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terri types on her arm keypad. She's amazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terri nods. McConnell starts unscrewing his helmet ring. Luke follows suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terri starts taking off her helmet. In a few moments, all three helmets are off. They hold them, glowing softly, against their chests, as they breathe deeply and gratefully. Air. And then, at this very moment, as if they have just passed another kind of test...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (alarmed) Jim, what're you doing? You'll depressurize!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jim, seal it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. That was air going into my suit, not out. Look at your own suits -- they're not rigid anymore. We've got pressure in here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Above Mars atmospheric? That's impossible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're millions of miles from Earth and we're inside a gigantic white face. What's impossible?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's six psi in here... (taps more keys) Nitrogen and oxygen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Otherwise known as air?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, there may be some lethal trace gasses I haven't picked up yet, or... or... oh, the hell with it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Appears through the glare, soaring up before their startled eyes. White, metallic, composed of complexly-linked bands, plates, ramps. It's part of a STRUCTURE whose overall height and breadth keep us from understanding its purpose. But the hatch opening slowly in its side, at the top of an approach ramp, is unmistakable. Radiant white light streams out from within, forming a glowing tunnel, down towards the astronauts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Raising their gloves against the dazzling glow. At the end of this tunnel of light, inside the hatch frame
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And slowly resolves itself into a glowing humanoid form, which we somehow sense is female. She appears benign, wondrous. This glowing MARTIAN -- a holograph -- regards the astronauts for a few moments, then beckons to them, as if to say "Enter." All her motions are both calm and calming -- precise, unhurried, gracious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at each other. They're awed into silence, and still tense, but now more out of excitement and anticipation than fear. Their eyes agree: Let's go. They walk forward slowly, carrying their helmets, up the ramp and into the tunnel of light, following the Martian, who retreats before them. They go through the hatch and disappear inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DUSK Following the Martian, they find themselves in a round, open space, defined by light, with a smooth matte-metallic floor, but without apparent walls. The Martian stops, turns, facing them. The astronauts stop, too, uncertain what they're meant to do. Then the Martian gestures again. A cylindrical holographic column appears, rising from the floor in front of the astronauts. Inside it, a swirl of eerie lights, millions of them, like cosmic fireflies...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Set down their helmets, then cautiously converge around this column, forming a loose triangle. As they stare into it, the myriad lights are reflected off their own eyes and their spacesuits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The whirling lights resolve into images, which relate to them the story of ancient Mars:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: we do not recognize. All is peaceful, beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (softly) Is that what I think it is?
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. It's Mars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Tumbles through space towards the planet...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my God.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - CLOSER VIEW As thousands of small rocketships lift away from the surface, heading in a stream out of the solar system...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And a wall of fire and debris scours the planet. Oceans boil and vaporize. Two gigantic hunks are blasted out of the planet, spinning in flames...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Involuntarily flinch, bathed in the fiery images...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As dust storms roil across its cold, lifeless surface. The flaming hunks of molten rock cool into twin moons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stare at this devastation, deeply moved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The stream of Martian ships grows smaller and smaller as it continues on its epic voyage towards a new solar system. Then we zero in on
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As it peels off and goes in another direction. Graphics show a model of what the ship contains: the familiar double helix of DNA. The ship heads towards another blue planet in our solar system...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As it was then. More clouds than now, more ocean, and the landforms all wedged together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her voice is soft.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Earth, when it was still Pangaea. Before the continents separated.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Makes a fiery streak through Earth's atmosphere and plunges into the ocean. Instantly the image of the DNA double helix grows, filling the entire holographic column, then it begins to spin and pulse, disintegrating into a phantasmagoric whirl of new images...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cry out, stunned by the strobelike power of the display as
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flash into the holographic column, swimming, growing, crawling, leaping, flying: one-celled microscopic organisms, plankton, plants of all kinds, insects, then fish, dinosaurs, birds, small mammals, larger mammals -- the entire stunning panorama of evolution, distilled into a single explosive sequence, as the images wash over the dazzled, awestruck
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Until finally the images whirl away, the holographic column dissolves, leaving only a circle of glowing, concentric, colored rings on the floor. The astronauts are left staring at each other across the open space where the column had been.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now comes forward with outstretched arms and completes their circle, taking the fourth position. McConnell is opposite her glowing form, and Terri and Luke are at either side. The Martian reaches her arms out, inviting them to link hands. As they do so, the Martian seems to be staring directly into McConnell's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is in wondrous awe, his whole face radiant with joy. It's the first time we've ever seen him utterly without sadness or reserve. Staring at the Martian, he understands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McConnell and Luke look at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear a BELL-LIKE TONE, a single lingering high note, and simultaneously the outermost ring of the circle on the floor begins to glow brightly. It is an intense chromium yellow.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They're us. We're them...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're Martians...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what she means.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my God. The Cambrian explosion.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Almost six hundred million years ago, there was a sudden expansion of life on Earth. The first multi-celled plants and animals appeared. No one has ever understood why...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They seeded Earth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Step back, startled, unlinking their hands, and look at the circle of colored rings. These shade from yellow, on the outer rim, to a deeper yellow, then orange, then finally reds. Inside the final, deep red ring is a circle of indigo blue, about a meter across. Small points of light glitter here, like stars against a midnight sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steps closer to McConnell. She has picked him out in particular. Now she beckons for him to move inside the circle of colored rings, to stand on the indigo core.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks back at her, nods his understanding. For the first time she seems to smile. Benevolence, reassurance. Then as abruptly as she first appeared, she fades away. Vanishes. Luke and Terri look at McConnell, confused. There is a sudden, static-filled CRACKLE from their helmets, nearby on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terri picks up her helmet, leans into its mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even through the scratchy interference, they can hear the relief in Phil's voice. And then the desperation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then they hear only STATIC. His signal is lost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly the BELL-LIKE TONE REPEATS, at a lower register, with a more sustained note, and simultaneously, the last of the yellow circles of light begins to fade, as
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (over radio) ...in, please. Can you... me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Phil, we're here! We read you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank God! Listen, this storm is really -- (loud static)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: few more minutes, I can't -- (more static) You've gotta get back to the ship!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Phil? Phil...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Begins to glow brighter. McConnell turns, looking at this new color, then looks back at Luke and Terri.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terri looks at Luke, alarmed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She scoops up Luke's helmet, tosses it to him. As he catches it, she's already starting back out, in the direction they came from, and Luke follows her. Until they both become aware that McConnell isn't with them. They turn back. He's still rooted to the spot, his gaze locked on the indigo core of the colored rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McConnell doesn't turn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming back, she sees how calm he is. How certain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks into their faces. Terri is trying to grasp this idea, still incredulous. Luke has the beginning of a half smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke nods at the memory of Maggie's words. Terri remembers too. McConnell's passionate conviction is affecting them both.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terri looks at Luke. Luke is smiling. He understands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke steps closer, looking at his old friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They clasp hands for a moment. But in this moment is a lifetime of camaraderie, an eternity of farewell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke nods, deeply moved. He turns away, picking up his helmet, as Terri comes closer, looking at McConnell, a long unspoken beat. Her eyes are glistening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terri smiles. She is starting on the road to recovery. She's going to be okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terri nods. She digs into one of her suit's pockets, pulls something out. She hands it to McConnell, and his fist closes around it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McConnell smiles. Terri smiles back at him. Then she turns, picks up her helmet, and crosses to where Luke has paused, looking back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke and Terri exchange a final silent farewell with him, then hurry away, into the darkness.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We are in a ship. This is a ship. And the countdown has already started.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then let's get the hell out of here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jim...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jim, we gotta go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not coming with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stunned) What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you talking about? We've got to get home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's where I'm going. Don't you see? That's what all this is for. (McConnell gestures at the ship around them) You were right Terri. This is an invitation. To follow them. To follow them home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have to go. This is the mission now. To find out who we are. Isn't that why we came here? Like Maggie said, "To stand on a new world and look beyond it to the next one."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, when you think about it -- I wasn't even supposed to be here -- all the accidents, everything that got us to this point, it's just... it's just... I just know it's right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm okay. I know what I'm doing. But you're running out of time. You've gotta get back to the ERV and get off this planet. Now please go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I once felt like I was taking your turn. But now I think maybe you're taking mine. Guess I'm a little jealous.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks for saving my life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My pleasure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wish Woody were here to see this. He would've wanted to go too, Jim.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's here, Terri. We wouldn't have made it without him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take care, Jim.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Jim...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have a great ride.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Always do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Looks down at what Terri gave him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With the little Flash Gordon rocketship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grips this tightly as he looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE FACE. PLAINS OF CYDONIA. NIGHT The hanger-like hatch has reopened, and Luke and Terri, helmeted again, emerge from the Face. The leading edge of the dust storm is upon them. They can't see much more than a few meters. As they reach the rover, they hear, even in this chaos, that the deep pulsing tone of the Face has started again. They look at each other, uncertain what this means. But McConnell is now beyond their help. Luke keys his mike.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Phil? Phil, do you read? (to Terri) He's not reading.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can barely read you. Let's get the hell out of here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT PHIL Is anyone there? Can anyone read me? Phil gets no response. He is shaking, almost crying. He hesitates, then starts hitting some keys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which reads: "PRE-LAUNCH CHECKLIST."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT McConnell has shed his backpack, with its unneeded oxygen tank. He steps cautiously onto the colored rings. Nothing seems to happen. Moving further, he takes his place on the indigo circle at their core. He looks at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As it dips from orange into red; the BELL TONES are continuous now, very deep and rapid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The rover, with Luke and Terri inside, races away towards the safety of the ERV, as the maelstrom boils over the Face behind them. The sky is purplish black, thick with flying debris and eerie lightning flashes. Towering billows of dust chase them over the plain, nearly enveloping them as they speed towards us, passing OUT OF FRAME.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT McConnell reacts, surprised, as suddenly
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Begins to rise around him, swiftly and smoothly, coming up from the circumference of the indigo circle. Then a second, identical cylinder -- the top half -- drops down from somewhere overhead. The two sections meet and fuse in a flash of light, containing McConnell inside them, as neatly as if he were in a giant, transparent mailing tube.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fights against a stab of claustrophobia. Is he being imprisoned? Or somehow protected? Either way, he's virtually immobilized. In this tight space in his bulky suit, he can't even move his arms. Only his head and neck can still shift.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Phil is going over his final pre-launch checklist, flipping switches and pressing buttons. He looks at his
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which reads "1350."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His finger hovers over a "Fire" button. He licks his lips nervously, squeezes his eyes shut, and hits the button.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the words: "IGNITION SEQUENCE INITIATED" INT. MARTIAN SPACESHIP. NIGHT McConnell is straining inside the cylinder that surrounds him, when something catches his attention. He arches his neck, looking down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is beginning to fill the cylinder! It swirls in, from some unknown source, rising rapidly; already his lower boots are covered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Widen in alarm. He strains against the sides of the cylinder but
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slide helplessly across the smooth surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks down again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is up to his knees. Now his thighs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cranes his neck, staring up. Can he wedge himself higher, can he somehow climb to safety?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The entire "ceiling" of the Face is becoming translucent. He can see the dust storm, boiling overhead. And now, rising into this, are fiery coils of energy from the Face itself. These swirl and twist in every direction, like angry water snakes; battered by the fierce winds. Two vast forces on a collision course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Luke drives the rover through the blinding storm, as Terri stares at a dashboard computer screen. They have to shout to be heard over the ROARING WIND.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke looks over alarmed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I've lost the Base Camp beacon!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As the needle spins freely, giving no direction whatsoever.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No good! We're driving blind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll try to keep on a straight line! It's our only chance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't worry! I've worked with Phil for four years! I know Jim gave him a direct order, but he won't leave without us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The Rover races towards us, the front of the storm chasing it from behind, then completely overtaking the Rover. It disappears from view!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Phil sits in the pilot's seat. He is looking at a computer graphic that shows the engines readying to launch. With resignation, he keys his mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phil waits a second, then reaches slowly for a blinking red switch that reads "LAUNCH." He hesitates, then actually has his fingers on it, about to flip it, when he hears a crackle of static on the radio. Phil keys his mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Phil chokes back a sob. Blinking back the tears, he tries to compose himself, then keys his mike.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is ERV, do you read? ERV to Rover, do you read...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is ERV, do you read?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (very faint) Save the fuel, Phil. We're coming in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, Phil's not here right now. He left for Earth five minutes ago. Please leave your message at the beep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT FROM GROUND LEVEL we see that the coils of energy are rising from the forehead of the Face, from its "third eye," spinning and looping faster and faster, starting to form a vortex. But unlike the wind vortex that killed the Mars One crew, this is a vortex of fire. As we watch, more fiery streaks begin to emerge from the sides of the Face, from the chin, cheeks and temples. These all rush upwards, like lava flowing uphill, gathering in intensity as they leap free of the Face itself and spiral into the atmosphere. The peak of the forming vortex is already piercing the lowest layer of storm clouds, causing a dark counter-swirl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Phil stands at the bottom of the ERV's ladder, gripping it to steady himself, staring into the swirling dust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: appears out of the dust and sand, the immense storm seeming to chase it from behind. Luke and Terri climb out, struggle towards him through the wind. Phil grips their hands, helping them over to the ladder. He looks back, confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phil stares at her, bewildered.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where's Jim?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He got another ride.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell you on the way. Let's go!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: NIGHT LOOKING DOWN INTO THE CYLINDER,

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT LOOKING DOWN INTO THE CYLINDER, we see that the cobalt-blue fluid has risen to McConnell's upper chest. Now it's at his shoulders! It pours into his suit through his neck ring. He strains on tiptoes, craning his head back, trying to keep his unhelmeted face above the rising liquid. He sucks in deep desperate gulps of air, his head thrashing from side to side. Then suddenly the fluid is over his mouth, his nose, his forehead. His whole body is submerged! The level of fluid continues to rise towards the unseen top of the cylinder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Squeezes his eyes shut, holding his breath. Not so much fighting this anymore as simply floating in place, waiting for his inevitable death...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT WIDEVIEW FROM ABOVE, as the energy vortex bends from side to side, pushing back the swirling storm that surrounds the Face. As the vortex coalesces its energy into a cylindrical shape, we see through its center to a rising form -- the Martian ship. It is a flattened convex circle whose matte- metallic angles replicate the "Face" imagery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. SIDEVIEW FROM INSIDE THE FACE As the Face burns away around us, the Martian ship begins to rise and spin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The vortex is now a tight, rapidly spinning cylinder. As it draws more and more power from the disintegrating Face, the Martian ship in its center spins faster and faster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT MCCONNELL'S FACE Is spinning and shaking too, more and more violently, as the huge buildup of G-forces tears at his body. We're reminded of Nick Willis just before the vortex exploded him; is the same thing about to happen to McConnell? His eyes remain tightly shut, bubbles are streaming from his lips. His last breath is nearly exhausted, it's being shaken from his lungs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT As we MOVE IN CLOSER ON HIS FACE, we suddenly see, with him, a SERIES of rapid-fire, almost subliminal IMAGES FROM THE PAST. We recognize each one. Previously, though, we saw them as still photos; now they have movement, life, and we view them from new and slightly different angles. These images INTERCUT with glimpses of McConnell's pale, shaking, near- death face in the present...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Under the Christmas tree, lifts his new model rocket from its box. He turns to us, smiling joyfully. A blinding white flash, and he disappears...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is on her porch, under a night sky, bending down to the eyepiece of a TELESCOPE. She looks up at us with a shy, proud smile. A blinding white flash and she's gone...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In flight suits, holding their helmets, stand on the wing of a fighter jet. The radiant young couple turn to each other, kissing. A blinding white flash and they vanish...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In an astronaut's pressure suit, drifts rapidly towards us, reeling in along a tether. A man's gloved hand is outstretched, reaching for her. As she grips the hand, we see her triumphant expression through her faceplate. A blinding flash; she's gone...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is shaking savagely; he is very near death. And then, all at once, the SHAKING STOPS. Time itself seems to stop. McConnell opens his eyes, staring STRAIGHT AT US. And then, fully accepting his fate, he throws his head back, opens his mouth and takes in a deep lungful of the fluid. He can breathe it. His eyes widen in surprise and understanding. He can breathe it! This fluid will keep him alive! His whole body relaxes, the tension draining from his head and shoulders, as he fully trusts this launch for the first time. And then, with his eyes wide open, he sees, from memory, one final image...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And REVEALS, in CLOSEUP, the beautiful face, the shining eyes of MAGGIE McCONNELL. Beatific, eternal. She gazes directly INTO CAMERA, then smiles...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smiles back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT WIDE VIEW, FROM ABOVE, as the energy vortex changes from red- orange to blue-white. It ROARS with terrifying power as its top starts to bend, angling like a telescope towards a specific point in the stars. Then the Martian ship -- a rounded darker form, little more than a blip within the vast, blue-white column of energy -- shoots away from the surface, leaving only a blacked crater where the Face had been.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HIGH ATMOSPHERE. NIGHT ANGLE FROM DEEP SPACE, LOOKING DOWN, as the Martian ship, riding its blue-white column of energy, streaks up into the vast blackness, like a narrowly focused spotlight piercing the night. Down below, we can see the dust storm in all its vastness still boiling orange and brown across the planet's surface, which it now completely covers. As the Martian ship flashes by us, it passes another ship, much smaller and slower, rising through the storm clouds on a different trajectory. We recognize the familiar, comfortable sight of the ERV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We see three figures in the cockpit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Luke, Terri and Phil are strapped in, with their acceleration just starting to level off, when suddenly their cockpit interior is starkly bathed in white light. They wince at the unearthly radiance, shielding their faceplates with gloved hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through their cockpit window, they watch the Martian ship hurtle by them at a hundred times their speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke nods. Their eyes are glistening. Luke's voice is a whisper, both of prayer and farewell.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Dear God. Look at that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Godspeed Jim McConnell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction
